intro: Grammosciadium longilobum, commonly known as the long-lobed grammosciadium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with prominent, elongated lobes, giving it its common name. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense, terminal clusters. Grammosciadium longilobum is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich, well-drained soils.
